locations.name: The Bachelor Mansion (Villa de la Vina)
locations.description: The most iconic home in reality TV history, Villa de la Vina has hosted over 20 years of rose ceremonies, dramatic entrances, and romantic proposals.
locations.bestTimeToVisit: Spring for blooming gardens, fall for mild weather

faqs.question: Where is The Bachelor Mansion located?
faqs.answer: The Bachelor Mansion is located at 2351 Kanan Road in Agoura Hills, California, about 35 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles.

faqs.question: Can you visit The Bachelor Mansion?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can rent the mansion on Airbnb for $6,000-$30,000 per night. It hosts weddings, proposals, and special events.

meta.title: Bachelor Mansion | Book the Iconic Villa de la Vina
meta.description: Rent the Bachelor Mansion for your own rose ceremony. The iconic California estate from The Bachelor is available on Airbnb.

locations.name: Playa Escondida Resort

faqs.question: Can you stay at the Bachelor in Paradise resort?
faqs.answer: Yes! Playa Escondida is fully bookable and actively markets itself as the BIP filming location.

faqs.question: What is the Boom Boom Room?
faqs.answer: The Boom Boom Room is the only air-conditioned room at the resort, famous for private couple time on the show.

faqs.question: How is Love Is Blind Japan unique?
faqs.answer: Japanese cultural elements like family approval, gift-giving traditions, and indirect communication create fascinating dynamics. The cinematography is exceptionally beautiful.

faqs.question: Where are dates filmed?
faqs.answer: Couples explore Tokyo's Shibuya, Ginza, Asakusa temple area, and scenic spots like teamLab Borderless. The retreat is typically at a traditional ryokan.
